channel.title: dataviz on Joel Soroos
channel.description: Recent content in dataviz on Joel Soroos

item.title: Favorite links
item.description: Learning R “R for Data Science” — seminal Tidyverse book by Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund “Learning R Step by Step” - hard copy book by Richard Cotton Statistics with R — online Duke courses via Coursera R Programming — online Johns Hopkins class via Coursera Advanced R - advanced R primer by Hadley Wickham Sourcing Setting environmental variables Spotify API Wrangling Getting and Cleaning Data in R — online Johns Hopkins class via Coursera Data wrangling in dplyr - tutorials by Susan Baert Pivot wide & pivot long - new dplyr reshaping tools Regular expressions Simplify lists to data frames Modelling Distance matrixes Clustering Visualizing Fundamentals “Fundamentals of Data Visualization” — free online book by Claus Wilke.

item.title: Visualizations
item.description: A collection of data visualizations I have built for fun using the R programming language. All visualizations are produced via code without post-processing. The examples source data from the weekly R4DS #TidyTuesday project, which is a community for R and tidyverse enthusisasts to practice and share ideas in wrangling, exploring and visualizing data.
